Package ca.mcgill.ecse211.t14

Class SearchAndRescue

java.lang.Object
ca.mcgill.ecse211.t14.SearchAndRescue
public class SearchAndRescue
extends java.lang.Object
This class provides methods to search and rescue the stranded vehicle and provides methods to avoid obstacles.
Author:
ANDREW TA, SEAN TAN

  • Constructor Details

    • SearchAndRescue

      public SearchAndRescue()

  • Method Details

    • searchForTheCart

      public static boolean searchForTheCart()
      This method locates the stranded vehicle within the search zone. Upon entering the search zone, the robot will use the provided search zone coordinates and UltrasonicWatcher to orient itself perpendicular to the left wall of the search zone. Using LineWatcher, the robot will orient itself along a grid line. The robot will then perform a sweep from that grid line toward the right direction, simultaneously polling distances. A variable OBJECT_DETECTION_THRESHOLD is set to a distance of 10 cm. In the case that a polled distance falls below this 10 cm threshold, a boolean variable objectDetected indicates that an object has been detected. The robot then navigates such that it is a distance of 10 cm from the detected object. A variable CART_DETECTION_ANGLE set to 60Âº is used to distinguish the stranded cart from other detected objects. Using UltrasonicWatcher the robot performs a sweep of the detected object. A variable OBJECT_ANGLEis calculated based on the rising/falling edges of when the ultrasonic sensor detects an object and when it does not. If the computed OBJECT_ANGLE is within 3Âº of the set CART_DETECTION_ANGLE, then the method confirms that the detected object is the stranded vehicle.
      Returns:
      true if the stranded vehicle is located successfully; false otherwise.

    • locateAttachmentPoint

      public static boolean locateAttachmentPoint()
      This method locates the point of attachment that will be used by the robot to secure the stranded vehicle for towing. Using the light sensor and ColourArbiter, the robot scans the detected vehicle until it identifies the Colour associated with the attachment point. Assume that the attachment point has a colour associated with it in the form of coloured electrical tape.
      Returns:
      true if the attachment point is located successfully; false otherwise.

    • rescueTheCart

      public static void rescueTheCart()
      This method positions the robot over the stranded cart such that it is able to continue navigating with the cart captured inside. Upon completion of locateAttachmentPoint(), the robot positions itself such that the front opening is aligned with the cart. The robot opens the door to the containment area, then using the ultrasonic sensor to determine the distance from the cart, the robot drives forward a certain distance until the cart is completely enclosed under the robot. The robot then closes the door to the containment area thus securing the cart inside. Using the coordinates provided, the robot then navigates back to the starting point with the cart secured.

    • avoidObstacle

      public static void avoidObstacle()
      This method navigates the robot around any detected object, not including the stranded cart, in order to avoid collision. Utilizing a bang-bang controller method, the error distError is computed by finding the difference between ideal MIN_DIST and the actual distance. By comparing the distError with threshold values, four cases are implemented: (1) the robot is on the correct heading, (2) the robot is extremely close to collision, (3) the robot is too far from the object and (4) the robot is too close to the object. Based on which case the robot is currently in with respect to the object, the necessary maneuvers are executed such that the robot remains at a comfortable distance away from the object. Once detectObstacle() returns false and readUSDistance() is at a maximum, the robot has successfully clear of the object and can proceed on its course. (Similar to the implementation logic for Lab 1 - Wall Follower).

    • readUSDistance

      public int readUSDistance()
      This method returns the filtered distance between the obstacle and the ultrasonic sensor in cm.
      Returns:
      the filtered distance between the obstacle and the ultrasonic sensor in cm
